title: January 20
description:
We're in the middle of the driest wet season in California since records began.

It's very pleasant. However, the governor declared a state of emergency for the drought, so we suppose we'll start dying of dehydration soon. Farewell.

children.title: 900 Grayson
children.description:
We went on a 17 mile bike ride Saturday (that's 27km, for those of you living in a rational country).

First stop: lunch at 900 Grayson, one of our favorite brunch places. You can see it in the background.

children.title: Lock Up
children.description:
900 Grayson's on the same block as Felix's middle school. Lucie measured the distance using the RunKeeper app. Verdict: Felix's daily bike ride to school and back home is 5 miles (8km). Not a bad way to stay in shape!

We thought Felix would stop biking to school during the rainy season but the rainy season has yet to materialize. We're having an exceptionally dry year. In fact, California's governor Jerry Brown declared a drought state of emergency this week. Water rationing isn't mandatory yet but we are heading that way.

children.title: Old Bridges
children.description:
Our destination: the bike path on the new Bay Bridge.

As we ride up, we get a great view of the old Bay Bridge. It is being carefully dismantled.

children.title: In Shape
children.description: The long bike ride barely  made a dent in Felix's energy. The kid has endurance. Milo got tired on some of the uphills but he did great too. Where should we take them to next?

children.title: Two Bridges
children.description: At the end of the path, we took a well-deserved cookie break and admired the two bridges.

children.title: End of Path
children.description: The path doesn't go all the way to San Francisco. It doesn't even reach Treasure Island yet.  They say it'll get connected Summer 2015.

children.title: Epiphanie
children.description: For epiphany, we ate our Galette des Rois at Laura's house. Sarah and Lucie got the "f√®ves". Lucie chose Dean as her king. Sarah chose Milo.

children.title: Figurines
children.description: For Christmas, Felix got a toolbox to store all his Pathfinder figurines. He also got a bunch of figurines and a stack of thick rulebooks. He is diligently making character sheet for all his friends.

children.title: Holden
children.description: Lazy Sunday afternoon playing Pathfinder with Holden.

children.title: Scavenger
children.description:
All school children have a holiday January 20, Martin Luther King day. Our boys spent a couple hours roaming the neighborhood with twins Addison and Parker on a scavenger hunt.

Moms Lucie and Hillary assembled a list of things to gather. Some of the things on the list were photos the kids had to take.

The boys were also entrusted with lunch money. They bought burritos and spent the change at the arcade next door. All of them agree that this was the best part of the scavenger hunt.

children.title: Story Time
children.description:
Both Felix and Milo read perfectly well, but there is still something special about having a parent read to you.

Most nights, Dean reads one or two chapters from a book. Lucie tags along for the first couple of nights and decides whether she is interested in that particular book.

children.title: Spy School
children.description: At the moment, the book is Spy School by Stuart Gibbs. It's a good one. All of us are caught up in it and eagerly wait for the next installment.

children.title: Drama
children.description:
Spy School is about Ben Ripley, a middle schooler who gets recruited by a junior C.I.A. academy. There is lots of action, drama and humor.

As always, Dean is fantastic at making unique voices for each character.

children.title: Bedtime
children.description:
Every evening, Felix and Milo beg Dean to read one more chapter. Sometimes he says yes, sometimes he says no. But sooner or later, the reading comes to an end.

It's always begrudgingly that the kids shuffle out of our bed and toward theirs.
